content.description: MODEL OF THE LATIN AMERICAN CITY
content.question: Compared to the patterns shown in urban models of the United States and Canada, the Latin American city model best explains which of the following patterns?

choices.label: Manufacturing districts are adjacent to the center of the city.
Income levels and land values increase toward the center of the city and along the spine.
Plazas are increasingly being built along peripheral areas.
Squatter settlements are rapidly shrinking in the periphery and increasing in the central city.
Gentrification has greatly improved housing along peripheral areas.

content.answer: Income levels and land values increase toward the center of the city and along the spine.

unit.text: 6: Cities and Urban Land-Use Patterns and Processes

skill.text: Skill 4.D: Compare patterns and trends in sources to draw conclusions.
